title: Firefox will not work after the update this morning
content:
Greetings Ya'll,

Early this morning as I went to use the Firefox browser, on My Desktop, I got an update, & then firefox opened, somewhat. 

The homepage did not fill in with favorites, suggestions, etc, and in fact all that did load was the Search bar, but not one of my usual website buttons. The "edit", "help", etc. buttons at the upper left hand corner did load, but that is all.

Not one of the buttons work, nor can I close out the Firefox page, by tapping the "X" in the upper right hand corner.

The only way that I could close out the "Firefox Page" was by going through the "Control/Alt/Delete" & then "Signing Out", which would initiate a "Re-start". Once I signed in, I could return to the Desktop, where everything works.

I use Firefox as my Browser on my Android phone, & at this moment, I've not had any problems using Firefox on my Cell Phone.

The only way that I could get to the Mozilla Website was by using the Microsoft Edge Browser, which is not giving me any problems as far as accessing the Internet!

How can I correct this problem, & go back to the Firefox Browser?
creator: DavidDeBord

title: Opening PDFs in system application
content:
Hi All,

I've set Firefox to open PDFs in the default system application (I'm on Linux, KDE, Firefox 146). With previous versions it worked fine. Now, it won't open the file; instead it shows a popup that I have to click to open the file.

Is there a setting I can tweak to get the old behavior back?

Thanks

GI

title: Firefox startet immer Vollbildmodus
content:
Hallo, ich habe das problem das mein Firefox browser immer im Vollbild modus startet, das hat er vorher nie gemacht. ich kann es zwar über die F11 taste zurücksetzen aber das ist nicht gut, auch habe ich schon einträge in der about:config gemacht die das verhindern sollten was aber auch nichts gebracht hatt. Es wäre schön wenn man das problem beseitigen könnte.

Ichhabe auch schon alle pluging mal ausgeschaltet um es zu testen hat aber auch nichts gebracht. Vielelicht liegt es ja doch an Firefox selbst.

Es wäre schön wenn mir da jemand weiter helfen könnte.

Danke Olaf

title: Shift + v, i, other keys launches DevTools and it is not my PC (Wondows 10) issue
content: i am trying to type this message on firefox, but i have to avoid shift key not to interrupt typing. when i hot shift+some other keys like i, b, v, etc, devtools pop up. i have checked other forums, other q&a on firefox support, and concluded that the same issue have occurred to many users regardless of the os, features, extensions, various keyboards (but not the virtual one for me) or system settings. i have to type a lot in the browser, so i just choose to delete firefox until someday the issue is fixed.

title: Slowness after update to V 140.6.0 (Dec 08, 2025)
content:
Hi Team,

after the mentioned update about a week ago, I experience quite some system slowness. Building up new pages takes between 30 and 60 seconds each, and some live streams are interrupted (3 seconds running, 3 seconds stop, 3 seconds running, etc.). This has never happened before. My Internet connection is good (confirmed by the provider), and using Google Chrome, all is as it should be, no slowness, no disruptions.

Can anybody advise, what the cause(s) could be, and how to solve these issues? Please let me know, if you need more information.

I really would like to continue using Firefox.

Many thanks in advance for your assistance,

Michael from Norway
creator: michael.campbell

title: Structured Headings Used but SEO Impact Not Clear
content:
Hello,

I am facing an issue with my website related to search engine visibility. Despite using proper SEO practices such as structured headings (H1, H2, H3), optimized content, and regular publishing, some of my pages are either not indexing or not ranking as expected.

Additionally, in some search results, incorrect brand information or unrelated images appear, which may be affecting trust and visibility.

I would like guidance on identifying the root cause of this issue and recommendations to improve indexing accuracy and overall SEO performance.

Thank you for your support. If you are manufactures also contact for BIS Certification.

title: Connessione interrotta: potenziale rischio per la sicurezza
content: Buongiorno, da un paio di giorni se cerco di aprire pagine su Google mi da questo errore : Codice di errore: SSL_ERROR_BAD_CERT_DOMAIN ho cancellato cronologia e cache , ho provato a resettare il modem /router , provato a collegarmi traite wifi del cellulare ma niente da fare. Ho notato che mi capita errore simile anche se accedo a Chrome . In quel caso errore è :Codice di errore: net::ERR_CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID. . Mentre se accedo ad internet tramite Microsoft Edge tutto va bene . Come mai ? Grazie

title: Problemi con salva e copia incolla
content: Ho quasi 80 anni. Lavoro molto col pc, ma non sono "tecnologica" ed i cambiamenti mi stravolgono. L'intelligenza artificiale mi ha definitivamente destabilizzata. Ho window10, e non mi funzziona più il "copia incolla" e il "salva con nome" perchè mi chiede di scegliere un non so cosa. Ho letto tutto l'articolo che mi ha confusa ancor più perchè mi dice anche di stare attenta a chi scelgo. Ho provato ad eliminare non scegliendo nulla e adesso non mi compare neanche più l'avviso. Sono costretta a digitare numeri lunghissimi come gli Iban e quanto altro. Non si può fare questo agli anziani! Ragazzi, datemi una mano e godetevi il progresso, ma non ci destabilizzate. Attendo risposta. Un bacio.

title: I am against the new push for AI integration in Firefox
content: I am so frustrated and disappointed with the current direction that Mozilla is talking with Firefox and AI Integration. I have used Firefox for years and have financially supported Mozilla in the past. For the time being, I am sticking with Firefox because the Al integrations can currently be turned off. I believe these options should be opt-in NOT opt -out. I feel loyal and dedicated to Mozilla's valves of privacy and a free-internet. But I will not think twice about jumping ship to another browser if Mozilla continues on this path of full-throated support and opt-out AI integration into Firefox. And I refuse to continue my financial support of the Mozilla foundation while this is the current direction of Mozilla leadership. I sincerely hope leadership will take the feedback of the community seriously and alter the current direction for the browser.

title: Firefox will not find or acknowledge backup file
content:
I just moved to a new Windows 11 PC from my Windows 10 PC. I backed up my Firefox profile and put it on a portable drive. I loaded Firefox on the new PC and then found the folder where the profiles are. I added the profile folder from the backup. Firefox has not found it and there is no way I've been able to discern to search for it.

I added the anti-virus after trying to set up Firefox.

Here are the particulars: Firefox version 146.0.1 (64-bit) Windows 11 Application Binary: C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe Profile folder: C:\Users\xxxx\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\xxxx.default-release

Any help appreciated.
creator: idahoc

title: I don't want AI slop
content: If Firefox continues to integrate AI into it's browser, I will abandon it completely. AI does not need to be in a browser. At all. Period. I don't want a chatbot giving me bullcrap answers to everything I search or say. Nobody wants this, nobody likes it. Not only is it annoying to deal with, but it is actively harmful and dangerous to online safety and gives rampant misinformation- and that's not even talking about how it can steal your passwords with prompt injection. If Mozilla goes ahead with this, I'll make sure to never touch this damn browser ever again. Rethink your choices.
creator: foveiin

title: How do I delete passwords from Firefox Sync? Deleted on one device, but they're still on the others
content:
Hello,

How can I remove all my saved passwords from Firefox Sync? On my desktop, I went to Menu > Passwords > Three Dots > Remove all passwords, and they're gone. However, on my mobile phone, they're still there. So the sync functionality is borked. The question is, are the passwords still on Mozilla servers, or is just the sync to my mobile buggy?

Even if I were to delete my FF Sync account, for good measure I'd like to manually delete all passwords from it first though.

Any help welcome.

title: I hate AI
content: if Mozilla continues on its path of adding new AI features into Firefox, i am going to switch browsers. I stopped using chrome, i can stop using Firefox too. Nobody using Firefox needs more AI features. Nobody using Firefox needs a "modern AI browser", as there's already about 10 browsers filled to the brim with AI slopware. this is an extremely disappointing turn for Mozilla to take and I'm hoping they realize their mistakes before it's too late.

title: I hate AI and I will abandon firefox
content: I do not need or want AI. The vast majority of firefox users, many of whom transferred to get away from AI, would agree. What for, anyway? To name tab groups? How is that worth spiking the use of my CPU and power? I switched to firefox *years* ago for one reason: it runs much better than chrome and it was committed to privacy and such. I know there are options to turn off these and the other AI features but with the CEO's desire to make firefox a "modern AI browser" I fear it will only get worse. How long will it stay optional? I might as well leave now and get used to waterfox, before firefox becomes utterly enshittified and unusable.

title: Online purchases using Firefox
content:
I'm using a macbook pro, running OS 14.6.1. Firefox is my default browser.

For quite some time now, whenvever I'm attempting to make an online purchase, once my payment information is entered, it just hangs, and either takes as much as 10 minutes for the purchase to go through, or it never goes through, it just keeps spinning. This is the case regardless of what website I'm ordering from, and regardless of what credit card i use.

When I switch browsers to Chrome (which i prefer not to do), it all works seamlessly and immediately.

My Firefox browser is up to date. My OS is a little out of date, deliberately, because of many reports that the current update can actually slow things down. But in spite of this, I have no trouble with anything except trying to make a purchase.

Can anyone help? Many thanks, Allan
creator: allanwny
